sources.title: Ladies in Love
sources.description: * 1930-05-15 *Pre-code Film * MUSICAL/COMEDY/ROMANCE (USA Eng) * Chesterfield Motion Picture Corp * STARRING: Alice Day (Brenda), Johnnie Walker (Harry), Freeman Wood (Ward) * DIRECTOR: Edgar Lewis; Melville Shyer (Assistant), Al D'Agostino (Art) * PRODUCER: George R. Batcheller * WRITER: Charles Beahan * CINEMATOGRAPHY: M.A.Andersen * EDITOR: James Morley * LYRICS & MUSIC: Lester Lee * CONDUCTORS: (Recorded by) L.E. Tope * SOURCE: This Film, Wikipedia and "MrFilmschatten" * I own ZERO percent of this film; I have uploaded for EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY. Doreen (def gp ddh)

metadata.Plot: A college football player (Joe E. Brown) persuades a beautiful young woman (Joan Bennett) to individually flirt with an entire team of All-American football players, in order to entice them over to her college. But the players get angry and threaten to walk out when they find out that they have been fooled, and they get even madder when they discover that she has actually fallen in love with one of their own teammates (James Hall).
metadata.Writer: Darryl F. Zanuck, Joseph Jackson, George Ade
metadata.Actors: Joan Bennett, Joe E. Brown, James Hall
